meanings.definition: Including or offering a comprehensive view
meanings.sent1: The panoptic camera captured the entire landscape in one shot.
meanings.sent2: The panoptic view from the top of the hill was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The panoptic mirror in the funhouse made everyone look distorted.
meanings.sent4: Her panoptic vision of the situation allowed her to see all angles.
meanings.sent5: The panoptic painting displayed every detail of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: A type of prison design allowing all inmates to be observed from a single point
meanings.sent1: The guard tower provided a panoptic view of the entire prison yard.
meanings.sent2: The panoptic layout of the prison allowed for constant surveillance.
meanings.sent3: The panoptic prison design made escape nearly impossible.
meanings.sent4: The panoptic nature of the prison felt suffocating to the inmates.
meanings.sent5: The panoptic structure of the prison kept everyone under watchful eyes.
